param.name: enabled
param.label: Enable {PSP} E-Payments
param.description: Whether you want to offer payments through {PSP}.
param.option: Enable auto-recurring payments (Alias Manager and DirectLink options needed)
Enable single and auto-recurring payments at user's choice

param.name: normal_gateway
param.label: {PSP} server
param.description: Select the payments gateway to use.

param.name: gateway_psp_url
param.label: Server submission URL
param.description: This should be the {PSP}-compatible-server equivalent of {PSPPRODURL}

param.name: pspid
param.label: {PSP} Shop id (PSPID)
param.description: Your {PSP} shop id (case sensitive) as confirmed by {PSP}.

param.name: sha_signature
param.label: {PSP} e-Commerce SHA Pass phrase (SHA-IN)
param.description: Your {PSP} e-Commerce SHA Pass phrase as set in {PSP} admin area under Technical Information - Data and origin verification tab.

param.name: sha_algorithm
param.label: {PSP} SHA (SHA-IN) Hash algorithm
param.description: Your setting for the Hash algorithm as set in {PSP} admin area under Technical Information - Global security parameters tab. Note: in same tab, "Compose the string to be hashed by concatenating the value of" must be set to "Each parameter followed by the pass phrase."

param.name: sha_signature_out
param.label: {PSP} SHA Pass phrase (SHA-OUT)
param.description: Your {PSP} SHA-OUT Pass phrase as set in {PSP} admin area under Technical Information - Transaction feedback tab - All transaction submission modes - Security for request parameters - SHA-OUT Pass phrase. Note: also set "HTTP request for status changes" to "For each offline status change (payment, cancellation...)." for maximal automation

param.name: id
param.label: URL to set into {PSP} admin area in Technical Information - Transaction feedback tab - "Direct HTTP server-to-server request" and "HTTP request for status changes" - "URL on which the merchant wishes to get a deferred HTTP request, should the status of a transaction change offline"
param.default: First fill-in parameters above, then "Apply" this new gateway settings: Then this URL %s will be computed and displayed.
param.description: This is the URL to paste into {PSP} admin area. As that field is really tiny (max 150 chars!) you can ommit &format=raw (and if present, &no_html=1 ) if you can't paste all

param.name: operation
param.label: Paymment type
param.description: Immediate payment or defered payment (deferred payments can be changed or rejected, but this must be done through {PSP} admin area).

param.name: language
param.label: {PSP} user interface language
param.description: Language shown to the user (later we might add multilingual support).

param.name: accept_payment_condition
param.label: Accept payment once
param.description: This option allows to set when a payment is deemed as completed by CBSubs. Credit-card authorization is usually immediate, except if acquirer is offline. In some cases you want to defer capture.
param.option: Even if payment is pending authorization, authorized or captured
Payment is authorized, but do not necessarily captured
Payment is authorized and captured (means completed)

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_antifraud
fieldset.label: Anti-Fraud-helping hidden fields
fieldset.description: If the invoicing address corresponds to credit card invoicing address, sending these in hidden fields to {PSP} might help for anti-fraud:

param.name: givedescription
param.label: Send short description line of purchase
param.description: This is the bought items description line that has been shown to customer. If this is enabled, it will be transmitted to acquirer and to merchant, possibly to customer too (depending on acquirer).

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_alias_manager
fieldset.label: Alias Manager Option
fieldset.description: The "Alias Manager" feature allows to store safely the Credit Card at the payment server and to reference it in future payments. If you have subscribed to the "Alias Manager" feature at {PSP}, you can activate and configure it here:

param.name: alias_manager
param.label: Enable Alias Manager feature
param.description: Enable this only if you subscribed this feature and need it.
param.option: Enabled only for recurring payments (if not auto-recurring, you can trigger payments from the e-Terminal)

param.name: fieldset_for_alias_manager_explain
param.default: The customer will be displayed the reason you give below, with a checkbox just below with text: "I allow to store my financial coodinates. It will be used by my merchant to request recurring payments."

param.name: aliasusage
param.label: Text explaining to customer the reason for asking to store the financial coordinates
param.description: Must be text. We recommend to format it as a title and include information on how to unsubscribe.

param.name: aliasusage_already_existing
param.label: Text shown to customer above the restored hidden financial information
param.description: Must be text. If empty, same text as on previous stored payment will be displayed. We recommend to format it as a title and explain to user that he can leave the financial coordinates as presented (masked) to pay with the same payment method/credit card. You should also include information on how to unsubscribe.

param.name: aliasdeterminedby
param.label: Alias name determined by
param.description: Recommended default value: By Payment Service Provider

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_directlink
fieldset.label: DirectLink Option
fieldset.description: The "DirectLink" feature is needed to be able to do refunds from within CBSubs administrator area and also allows to execute payments from your server using Alias Manager payment method aliases for auto-recurring payments. If you have subscribed to the "DirectLink" feature at {PSP}, you can activate and configure it here:

param.name: directlink
param.label: Enable DirectLink feature
param.description: Enable this only if you subscribed this feature and need it.
param.option: Enabled for refunds and/or auto-recurring payments

param.name: directlink_showserverip
param.label: Current IP address of this server (See 'i')
param.description: This is the current IP address of this server as provided by the server. Warning: some servers can have multiple IP addresses, you should check with your hoster for complete list.

param.name: sha_signature_directlink
param.label: {PSP} DirectLink and Ogone Batch (Automatic) SHA-IN Pass phrase (See 'i')
param.description: Unless you are sure to never use non-ISO8859-1 characters, you should not set this because of an Ogone bug. Security-wise this is not really needed. This is your {PSP} DirectLink and {PSP} Batch (Automatic) SHA-IN Pass phrase as set in {PSP} admin area under Technical Information - Data and origin verification tab - Checks for {PSP} DirectLink and {PSP} Batch (Automatic).

param.name: directlink_userid
param.label: {PSP} DirectLink API User name
param.description: {PSP} DirectLink requires an API user. Enter the USERID Name of your application (API) user. Please refer to the {PSP} User Manager documentation and FAQ (What is a 'user for API'?) to create an API user.

param.name: directlink_pswd
param.label: {PSP} DirectLink API user password
param.description: Your {PSP} DirectLink ()USERID) password PSWD.

param.name: payment_methods_selection
param.label: Selection of payment method
param.option: all methods available at the payment service provider
only following payment methods of the payment service provider

param.name: pmlist
param.label: Payment methods list
param.description: enter a comma "," separated list of payment methods, e.g.: CreditCard,PostFinance Card,PostFinance e-finance,PAYPAL,UNEUROCOM,CBC Online,CENTEA Online,Dexia Direct Net,eDankort,EPS,giropay,iDEAL,ING HomePay,KBC Online,MPASS,paysafecard,Direct Debits AT,Direct Debits DE,Direct Debits NL,Acceptgiro,Bank transfer,Payment on Delivery,InterSolve,MiniTix,PingPing,TUNZ,Wallie

param.name: show_back_button
param.label: Show a "back" button on payment mask
param.description: If there is only one payment method, then you can show a "back" button on the payment form for the customer to be able to come back to your site to choose another payment method/gateway. Otherwise, only the "Cancel" button will be displayed, which cancels the transaction and basket.

param.name: single_radio_cardtypes
param.label: Images for accepted payment methods
param.description: Cards will display in the Name of the radio button

param.name: image
param.label: Payment Button
param.description: The payment button (visible only if an Intro Text is present or more than one payment processor enabled.

param.name: custom_image
param.label: Custom Button Text or Image
param.description: Either text of button or URL of a custom image (.gif, .jpg or .bmp), overwites selection above.

param.name: cardtypes
param.label: Accepted payment methods
param.description: Credit cards accepted shows in buttons

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_psp_presentation
fieldset.label: Presentation at the Payment Service Provider
fieldset.description: This is for the styling of the static payment page at the Payment Service Provider:

param.name: payment_template_type
param.label: Payment template type
param.description: You need to contact {PSP} and study their advanced documentation if you want to change this from static to dynamic.
param.option: Dynamic payment template from your site

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_dynamic_page
fieldset.label: Dynamic payment page
fieldset.description: This page is fetched from your site by the payment server and displayed in https, so all its references must be through valid https.

param.name: tp
param.label: URL of your html template page
param.description: http or https URL of your template page with "$$$PAYMENT ZONE$$$" in it. The URL must be absolute (contain the full path), it cannot be relative. Only standard ports 80 and 443 are supported.

param.name: title
param.label: Title text
param.description: Must be text

param.name: logo
param.label: https:URL or filename of the logo to display at the top left
param.description: URL/filename of the logo you want to display at the top of the payment page next to the title. The URL must be absolute (contain the full path), it cannot be relative and must start with https://. The logo needs to be stored on a secure server. If you do not have a secure environment to store your image, you can ask {PSP} to activate the “Logo Hosting” option in your Account. If the logo is stored on the {PSP} servers, you only need to enter the filename, not the whole URL.

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_static_styles
fieldset.label: Static payment page colors and text font

param.name: bgcolor
param.label: Background color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: white.

param.name: txtcolor
param.label: Text color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: black.

param.name: tblbgcolor
param.label: Table background color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: white.

param.name: tbltxtcolor
param.label: Table text color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: black.

param.name: buttonbgcolor
param.label: Button background color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: white.

param.name: buttontxtcolor
param.label: Button text color
param.description: Can be a CSS color name (e.g. white) or value (e.g. #ffffff), default: black.

param.name: fonttype
param.label: Font Family
param.description: Must be a web font family (arial, verdana, times or generic serif, sans-serif, cursive, fantasy, monospace). The font-family property specifies the font and can hold several comma-delimited font names as a fallback-system. If the browser does not support the first font, it tries the next font, default: Verdana.
